events.title: Guest Speaker: Aubrey Pratt from L3-Communications
events.description: Aubrey is a graduate of the Computer Engineering department and currently works at L3-Communications. We have the wonderful opportunity to hear more about her experience as a woman in technology.

events.title: Guest Speaker: Shauna Roundy from Microsoft
events.description: Shauna is one of the Senior Software Development Engineer’s (SDE’s) currently working in Microsoft's Lehi office. She will be coming to speak to the club about her experience as a women in a technical field.

events.title: Dinner with Susan R. Madsen and the Women in Science Club
events.description: Get ready for An Evening Celebrating Women put on by the Women in Science club! This will be a great opportunity to hear from Susan R. Madsen, the leader of the Utah Women and Education Initiative, and interact with other women in science! Dinner will be provided. To reserve a seat there is a $1 fee. We will collect this at our March 6th event.

events.title: Info Night about Research Assistant/Teacher Assistant Opportunities
events.description: Come hear more about what it is like to be a teacher assistant or research assistant! We'll have the opportunity to hear from several TAs and RAs about their experience, and then hear from a panel of professors.

events.title: Lunch with National Instruments
events.description: The Women in Engineering organization has invited us to one of their events next month. We will have the great opportunity of hearing from Alisha Pulsipher from National Instruments about her experiences as a woman engineer. She is a graduate of the Electrical Engineering program at BYU and now lives in Texas with her husband and newborn daughter Naomi. There are only 47 spots, so please RSVP here.

events.title: Mentoring Lunch with Dr. Julie Shah
events.description: WiCS is combining with the Society of Women Engineers (SWE) for a lunch with Dr. Julie Shah. Dr. Shah is an assistant professor at MIT in the department of aeronautics and astronautics. She will be presenting at the CS colloquium at 11:00 am on the 28th, so please plan to attend if you are interested in her research. The lunch will be in the evening and will focus on her experience as a woman in technology.

events.title: Google Event
events.description: Google is sponsoring a WiCS event. BYU's Google ambassador will demo one of Google's products for us. Then, we'll have some friendly competition and games. The winners will get FREE Google swag. Come get to know more women in computing and eat pizza!

events.title: Speaker: Moriah McClanahan
events.description: Moriah McClanahan from Symantec will be speaking to us on her experience in industry. Moriah received her undergrad in CS and later earned an MBA. She now works as a Senior Principal Business Intelligence Analyst.

events.title: Women in CS Opening Social
events.description: Don't miss out on good food, good information, and good company! We will be learning about opportunities available to women in computer science. Pizza will be served. Following this event, we will have events every 1st and 3rd Wednesdays at 6:00 pm.

events.title: Speaker: Carla Heesch
events.description: We have the amazing opportunity to hear from Carla Heesch this week. She has worked at Novell, and is now a stay-at-home mom. She has a wealth of experience and good advice to share. Refreshments will be provided. Carla will be giving us free resume advice so bring a resume!

events.title: National Instruments Women Outreach Event
events.description: Light snacks provided. Alisha Pulsipher graduated in Electrical Engineering from BYU in summer 2011 and has been working for National Instruments in Austin, TX for about a year now. She will be part of the recruiting team from NI visiting the week of the career fair (September 19-21). She will be providing an opportunity to chat about job hunting and starting work as a woman in a male-dominated field.

events.title: Opening Social
events.description: Welcome back to another semester! We are going to be having a brown bag opening social lunch. Bring your lunch and come to socialize with other women in the program! There will also be a raffle. :]
